trans-unit.source: Exposes methods used to return metadata about a service.
When programming [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] services, it is useful to publish metadata about the service.
For example, metadata can be a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document that describes all of the methods and data types employed by a service.
Returning metadata about an [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service allows consumers of a service to easily create clients for the service.
For more information about [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] metadata endpoints, see [Metadata](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/metadata.md).
Services implemented using [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] publish metadata by exposing one or more metadata endpoints.
Metadata endpoints in [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] have an address, a binding and a contract like any other endpoint.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataReference> interface specifies the service contract implemented by all metadata endpoints in [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)].
There is no need to implement the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataReference> contract in your service implementation.
Instead, add the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceMetadataBehavior> to the service description.
Or, when using configuration, set the `contract` attribute of the endpoint element to `IMetadataExchange`.
For an example, see [How to: Publish Metadata for a Service Using a Configuration File](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/how-to-publish-metadata-for-a-service-using-a-configuration-file.md).
For details on publishing metadata in [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] see [Publishing Metadata](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/publishing-metadata.md).
Starts an asynchronous retrieval of metadata.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> that should be processed to determine the metadata to return.
An <xref href="System.AsyncCallback"></xref> that points to the method that will process the metadata.
Any data which allows the caller to determine which asynchronous call is being returned.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> that can be passed to the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.IMetadataExchange.EndGet(System.IAsyncResult)"></xref> method.
Concludes the retrieval of metadata.
An <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> that contains data used to further process the metadata.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> containing the processed metadata.
Returns the service metadata.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> that contains the request for metadata.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message"></xref> containing the metadata.
